item.title: Jorge Araiza has been in sanctuary resisting deportation since...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Jorge Araiza has been in sanctuary resisting deportation since December of 2019.

He is the father of four U.S.-born children. Jorge has lived in the U.S. for 21 years. He grew up and attended school in Denver, and this is where he formed his family. Practically his entire direct family is in Colorado, including his parents, siblings, and his four children, who need him here with them. It would be a huge loss for his four children to not have their father. The youngest child i...s four years old, and needs his father.

Please support him by donating to and sharing his GoFundMe: https://gf.me/u/y46pfn

The legal costs are steep, and he needs every bit of help his community can offer.

See MoreJorge Araiza has been in sanctuary resisting deportation since December of 2019. He is the fa… Jorge Araiza needs your support for keep jorge with his family

item.title: Today's PSA: It's been 8 months since the country...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today's PSA:

It's been 8 months since the country flipped completely upside down. The relapse and overdose rate has increased by 30% since March 2020. Mental health issues related to our lockdown and the pandemic are especially hard for people with depression. NAMI, The National Alliance on Mental Health has a 24-hour helpline: 800-950-6264.

Now, I’m asking my small corner of FB to follow suit: Could any two of my Facebook friends just copy and re-post to share the helpline far and wide? Just two. Any two. Say done.

item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

This 'mass rebellion' training is tomorrow, Tuesday 5pm MDT, and is being led by long time activist Lisa Fithian. Regardless of what you're doing around the election, I'd recommend attending if you can. Lisa came out to Denver last year as part of her book tour and did an earlier version of this training (hosted by XR Denver and Abolish ICE Denver), and it was great.

item.title: "We are collaborating to bring you an event filled with...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"We are collaborating to bring you an event filled with culture, community, consciousness, climate action, voting and fun!

Xitlali Baila, Performing artist and Fashion Designer together with friends of Yes on 2A will host “Esencia Mexico" a climate conscious catwalk show in an effort to bring awareness on the importance of voting Yes on 2A. 2A would make Denver a leader in fighting the climate crisis https://climateactiondenver.com/.

We will have music, speakers, fashion, da...nce and information on how to help each of us be more environmentally friendly. We would love for you to join us!

6:30 “Esencia Mexico" will begin with speakers from Green Latinos, Yes on 2A and Universal Basic Resources. We will have a conscious catwalk fashion show, a dance performance and live music from Sontres.

We will be adhering to all social distancing and mask regulations. There will be indoor and outdoor seating areas so guests can pick where they feel most comfortable. Please RSVP."

See More

An Evening of Culture, Arts, Yes on 2A & “Esencia Mexico" a Conscious Catwalk

Abolish ICE Denver

Join community tomorrow for a press conference with Chris' friends and family.

A BLM protestor named Chris was ran over on their scooter this summer wearing a BLM mask in Denver and many in community feel that it's a major DPD coverup.

Chris was wearing a BLM mask, he tried to get his friends out of harms way and the driver redirected and targeted him, plowing into a group of black kids and killing Chris. All the kids are from out of town and coming back for the DPD press co...nference Tuesday

Tomorrow we expect police to say they found the car but no driver and DPD may even be closing the investigation b/c the car was supposedly reported stolen before the incident.

item.title: Read more about the miltia clowns that have been patrolling...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Read more about the miltia clowns that have been patrolling downtown Denver in response to the Black Liberation Movement protests this summer and were a part of the "Patriot Muster" on Oct 10 in which violent racist Lee Keltner attacked journalists 👀👇

Part of their manual includes tips for kidnapping protestors 😳😳

+21Denver Communists

Our comrade(s) who infiltrated the Colorado Unorganized Constitutional Militia passed along their Rules of Engagement slide deck. It is a vile, outlandish, and ...funny-if-it-wasn’t-scary document that details violent fantasies they desperately long to make real.

One thing this document makes clear: the far right is chomping at the bit to hurt Black Lives Matter protestors.

They hate the anti-racist rebellion that has gripped this country since cops murdered George Floyd. They hate to see oppressed people fight back. And they hate to see solidarity with the very groups they attempt to scapegoat.

These white-nationalist, patriot militia-types think cops aren’t repressing the movement violently enough, so they’re volunteering to do more. The Colorado Unorganized Constitutional Militia document, for instance, upholds Kyle Rittenhouse’s double-murder as an example that, “as patriotically awesome as it was to watch, we need to learn from.”

Right-wing vigilantism attempts to reinforce social inequality and uphold the status quo, not to subvert them. Historically, privatized and vigilante violence has been central to maintaining the racial and social order in the United States. Examples include the KKK, volunteer border patrols, the bosses’ private security forces, and white-on-Black race riots.

The militia’s violent fantasies transform cities like Denver into war zones. They claim that “not knowing where you are will get you killed,” as if there is danger inherent to urban neighborhoods. Playing to the fears of their mostly white, suburban and exurban, petit-bourgeois membership—the historic social base of fascism—helps motivate them toward violence.

The ultimate dream of these fascists is for their racist, rapist president to go beyond instructing them to “stand back and stand by” and give them the go-ahead to kidnap and kill protestors. They consider it an imminent possibility and they are actively making plans for that day.

Some highlights:

* The militia considers itself at “war with political driven [sic] Marxist groups.”

* The document is saturated with militaristic buzz words and concepts, like a chain of command and required combat gear.

* It details rules of engagement for “operating against BLM and Antifa,” which it refers to as “adversaries” and “enemies.”

* It instructs the militia to “be violent” and “shoot to kill, never to wound,” when they deem it justified via their pseudo-legalistic framework.

* It details what kinds of weapons to use, including pistols with at least 30 rounds and 9mm capacity, “long guns” in “mobile units,” knives, hard-knuckle gloves, and wasp spray.

* In addition to instructions to kill protestors, it suggests kidnapping them. For this purpose, militia members are instructed to carry zip ties and a “couple ripped up t-shirts for gags and blind folds.”

* It uses Trump’s racist phrase “China virus.”

* The document culminates in a bleak vision that demands the militia’s violent action. It claims the US is “entering into very dark times” when “patriots” are outnumbered and “under attack from Marxist [sic] that aim to destroy everything we have built.”

* It ends with the white-supremacist, neo-Nazi rallying cry, “Until Valhalla.” That’s an appropriate ending for a self-aggrandizing death cult.

Here’s the full document: https://gofile.io/d/dTxESt

See More

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverDenver CommunistsOn Saturday, October 10th, the Denver Communists, WITCH Denver, the Front Range Mutual Aid Network,...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverDenver Communists

On Saturday, October 10th, the Denver Communists, WITCH Denver, the Front Range Mutual Aid Network, Colorado Socialist Revolution - IMT, HOES - Help On Every St...reet, and others held a rally to oppose and confront a fascist militia gathering. Canned and dry foods were collected and hot meals were cooked and served. We also set up tables under canopies to facilitate political conversation, distribute Marxist literature, and invite the people we meet to organize with us to grow the anti-racist, anti-fascist movement. By mid-afternoon all of our goals had been accomplished--most importantly our counter protest had outnumbered, drowned out, and driven off the fascist rally.

As the ‘patriots’ shuffled off in defeat, a little over an hour after their assembly began, one of them struck, maced, and was subsequently shot and killed by another person. The best information we have is that the shooter was a Pinkerton security contractor employed by 9News, the local NBC affiliate. It has also come out that the person who was killed had violently attacked a Black Lives Matter protestor last summer and was aggressively confronting a Black man moments before the shooting. While we support the right to self-defense and encourage emancipatory collective self-defense independent of the capitalist state by the working class and the oppressed, we believe that our best defense is built with mass organization, not by individual acts of violence. Throughout the history of fascist and far-right organizing, mass movements of oppressed working class people mobilized to oppose them. This has proven to be the most effective, unequivocal and powerful solution.

Our experience on Saturday bears this out. Without firing a shot, or even connecting with a soup can, we were able to effectively repel the gathering of III%ers, Oath Keepers, Proud Boys, and other white nationalists, while building closer contacts with other workers looking to organize against racism, fascism, and capitalism more broadly. Some media outlets reporting on the event, including the one who employed the alleged shooter, imply that the Denver Communists and others involved in opposing the far-right gathering were responsible for the shooting. This isn’t just incorrect, it inverts the situation entirely--had they been able to assemble without our opposition, the militia-fascists would have felt more empowered to exercise violence, not less.

The police don’t do anything to stand against fascist violence-- not on Saturday nor this entire summer of mass uprising, not to speak of the historical camaraderie between cops and fascists. We’ve seen them work hand-in-hand with the armed right wing in Kenosha, Portland, and Minneapolis. It’s no different here in Denver where even when the police aren’t directly coordinating with militias and white-nationalist groups they’re always ready to defend them. On Saturday, while we fed the hungry with soup and communist politics, it was no coincidence that the police were facing our rally and kept their backs turned to the armed vigilantes behind them. We can’t rely on the state to oppose reactionary politics. Instead we seek to organize masses of workers to protect ourselves, our communities, and each other.

If we recognize that our power to combat fascism comes from masses organized against it, that also means that our orientation needs to be to the public. While we acknowledge the importance of security and safeguarding those involved in organizing with us, we believe that many have mistaken obscurity with security. Instead, the Denver Communists are committed to organizing publicly, openly, and confidently. We don’t see any other way to grow the large, combative social movements that are necessary to fight the increasingly deadly status quo. After the success of the BLM-Antifa Soup Drive, we look forward to confronting the far right again the next time they rear their ugly heads. We encourage anyone interested in getting involved to attend our next meeting, over Zoom this Wednesday, where we’ll discuss our approach to organizing against the far right.

See More

item.title: Via @coloradopeoplesalliance and the Detention Lifeline...
item.content:encoded:
Via @coloradopeoplesalliance and the Detention Lifeline

🚨Community Alert🚨
The Aurora Fire Chief notified council members of a COVID-19 outbreak at the GEO detention facility this afternoon. There are 19 confirmed positive cases! We know we can't count on GEO to keep our community members who are detained safe. We demand that GEO releases as many folks as possible on humanitarian parole and ensures that those who are sick receive the proper medical care! We will keep monitoring the situation and connect with folks inside the facility to ensure their health and safety.

Read our full press release here: https://coloradopeoplesalliance.ourpowerbase.net/civicrm/mailing/view?id=1271&reset=1

🚨Alerta a la comunidad🚨
El jefe de bomberos de Aurora notificó a los miembros del consejo sobre un brote de COVID-19 en el centro de detención de GEO en Aurora esta tarde. ¡Hay 19 casos positivos confirmados! Sabemos que no podemos contar con GEO para mantener seguros a los miembros de nuestra comunidad que están detenidos. Exigimos que GEO libere a la mayor cantidad posible de personas en libertad condicional humanitaria y garantice que los enfermos reciban la atención médica adecuada. Seguiremos al tanto de la situación y nos conectaremos con las personas dentro de las instalaciones para garantizar su salud y seguridad.

Lea nuestro comunicado de prensa completo aquí: https://coloradopeoplesalliance.ourpowerbase.net/civicrm/mailing/view?id=1271&reset=1
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

Palantir Technologies is ICE’s technology backbone, provides the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants."

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with...
item.content:encoded: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with difficulties accessing medication and sanitary products, serious COVID risks, abuse from guards, and intense stress from isolation (23+ hours a day). Their civil rights are also being violated with Denver, Adams and Arapahoe County working together to deny our comrades a bond hearing. Our comrades suffer yet they are still thinking of others — constantly telling communjty about the conditions of their cell mates and others in the jail and agitating for their release as well. @justiceforelijahmcclain PSL Denver and Say Their Names 5280 are heroes and freedom fighters. And we need to be fighting harder than ever for them. See you Saturday!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: After the success of last year's "Confront la Migra Where They Live!" house demonstration in the suburban neighborhood...
item.content:encoded:
After the success of last year's "Confront la Migra Where They Live!" house demonstration in the suburban neighborhood of GEO Warden Johnny Choate, @auroragov and APD spent nearly a QUARTER OF A MILLION dollars to police the Enough Coalition march up Colfax to GEO in the following week. In a SINGLE DAY A quarter million dollars were paid out to APD and Adams County officers just to try to intimidate us with fences and riot gear. That day, APD also tried to make our indigenous comrades drop their prayer sticks to enter on Oakland Street and when our comrades told APD, "You're in riot gear and have batons! Let us have our prayer sticks or we are gonna sue the shit out of you!"

Why does APD continue to do private security for Aurora GEO? La policia, la migra, misma porqueria!

Photos by @denvercommunists

#AbolishICE #ChingaLaMigra #closethecamps
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM @ Aurora GEO 3130 Oakland St...
item.content:encoded:
Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM @ Aurora GEO 3130 Oakland St

*Please adhere to 6ft social distancing - Wear your masks, bring your hand sanitizer.*

"We'll be highlighting the refugee and immigrant experience of our AAPI communities. We want to peacefully express our concerns about the new ICE Director appointment. Please join us in solidarity!

Asian refugee and immigrant speakers from Chinese, Vietnamese, And Korean backgrounds will provide their powerful stories and perspectives. Immigration advocates and activists will also provide updates on current issues surrounding immigration.

We invite you to sign postcards to express your support for ICE detainees that will be delivered to local legislators.

Please share this event and encourage others to show up and support!"
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Message us for the event link! This series is every Tuesday in person or online until Sept 29!...
item.content:encoded:
Message us for the event link! This series is every Tuesday in person or online until Sept 29!

https://facebook.com/events/s/immigration-is-an-lgbtq-issue-/269755914013547/?ti=cl

Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders
TUESDAYS @ 6:30pm • Sept. 8, 15*, 22 & 29

(This event is NOT being held at the Althea Center.)

ONLINE via Zoom to Facebook Live
• Sept. 15*: Only available online on this date.
• Recordings of the series will be posted on YouTube.
OR
ON-SITE (Raíces Brewing, 2060 West Colfax Ave.)
• In-person reservations REQUIRED & limited to first 50 people.

Drinks & Pizza at Raíces Brewing Company starting @ 5:30PM (Reservations required for Raíces)

Zoom Program and live streaming @ 6:30PM

Entertainment produced by Black Actors Guild @ 7:30-8:00PM

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders

Mariposa at the Althea Center, in partnership with NY-based Immigration Equality and American Friends Service Committee Colorado, will present “Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders,” 4-week series of programs highlighting some of the traumatizing circumstances and critical needs of our LGBTQ sisters and brothers seeking asylum in the United States.

With simultaneous Spanish/English interpretation provided for Zoom participants, we will hear powerful and personal migration stories from current and recent LGBTQ asylum seekers. PFLAG Las Cruces, NM, will share their “real life” model of hosting asylum seekers, for which they won an award last year from the national PFLAG organization. We will hear from national and local leaders doing the day-to-day work of assisting and supporting these asylum seekers.

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Denver Police have killed again! And they won’t stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Police have killed again! And they won’t stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed Antonio Blackbear, a 41-year-old Lakota man.

Antonio was the adopted cousin of another Lakota man killed by the Denver Police five years ago, Paul Castaway. Indigenous people are more likely than any other racial group to be killed by police.

There has been no semblance of justice for Paul in that time, since Denver District Attorneys, like their counterparts around the nation, refuse to hold police accountable for the violent, racist terror that forms the very core of their job description. We expect the fight for justice for Antonio to be a similarly difficult one.

The police have yet to release video of their killing of Antonio, nor say much about it, because they are working to craft a story that casts them in the best light.

Justice for Antonio Blackbear!
Defund, disarm, and disband the police!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
